content:
Diagnosis
	1. Right breast squamous cell carcinoma with pleural and pulmonary metastases

	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Jan 2024 Core biopsy right breast

	Chemotherapy
	1. First line carboplatin/gemcitabine Jan-March 2024
	2. Second line weekly paclitaxel March-April 2024

	Radiotherapy
	Not indicated

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	Progressive disease with worsening pleural effusion and new pulmonary nodules

	Current issues
	Breathlessness, chest pain, fatigue

	Summary of consultation
	I reviewed [redacted name] today who attended with her daughter. She has unfortunately experienced significant clinical deterioration over the past three weeks with worsening breathlessness, now requiring oxygen 2L/min at rest. Her exercise tolerance has reduced to approximately 20 meters. She describes constant right-sided chest pain requiring regular breakthrough analgesia.

Her most recent CT scan from 15 April 2024 shows progression of disease with enlarging pleural effusion and multiple new pulmonary nodules. The primary breast mass has also increased in size from 6.8cm to 8.2cm. Previous immunotherapy was discontinued after 2 cycles due to grade 3 pneumonitis requiring hospital admission.

We had a detailed discussion about prognosis and treatment options. Given her declining performance status (now ECOG 3) and previous immunotherapy-related toxicity, we agreed to transition to best supportive care with involvement of the palliative care team. She expressed a clear wish to focus on symptom management and quality of life.

	Further investigations
	Urgent pleural aspiration being arranged

	Medication prescribed
	1. Oxycodone modified release 20mg BD
	2. Breakthrough oxycodone 5mg PRN
	3. Regular dexamethasone 4mg daily

	Follow up
	Urgent palliative care review arranged for tomorrow
	Next oncology review in 2 weeks or sooner if needed

	Required GP actions
	Please support with community palliative care referral
	Prescribe breakthrough medications as above

	Summary of information given to patient
	Detailed discussion regarding disease progression and transition to palliative approach. Written information provided about palliative care services. Emergency contact numbers given.
